seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Danny Collins Takes Adventure Racers on a Wild Ride Through Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
I am Northwest Arkansas recently featured Danny Collins, the founder of 37 North Expeditions and the director of the upcoming Expedition Ozark race.

  • Exploring Ozarks: Adventure racers from 10 countries are competing in a five-day, 375-mile race that will take them through the breathtaking Ozarks.
  • Get outside: 37 North Expeditions curates exceptional outdoor experiences, providing the equipment and transportation, and taking the planning steps out for corporate groups looking for team bonding opportunities post-COVID.

Learn more about Expedition Ozark and Danny Collins' 37 North Expeditions here.

posts.title: Get Ready For The Amazeum's UnGala FUNdraiser
posts.content:
Play like a kid, eat, drink, and raise money for a great cause at the Scott Family Amazeum’s UnGala, an annual FUNdraiser for ages 21+ where you can experience one-of-a-kind activities that spark creativity and curiosity, on Apr 21, from 6-10p.

  • Kidding around: Race others in a souped-up, 24-volt racer, and try pewter casting, screen printing, and other cool hands-on activities. There will be an all-you-can-eat food truck buffet and a mad-scientist cocktail round!
  • Play with purpose: Thanks to the UnGala, the Amazeum can continue its nonprofit mission by hosting Priceless Nights, keeping the cost of general admission low, and providing professional development opportunities for local educators.

Prepare to unleash your creativity and get your tickets HERE.
posts.topic: Sponsored by the Scott Family Amazeum

posts.title: Springdale Residents to Vote on Bond Issues that Could Fund City Projects
posts.content:
Voters in Springdale will make decisions in a May 9 special bond election that could fund various improvement projects in the city.

  • Bonding structure: The bond change will allow the city to restructure bonds for the purpose of funding projects including updating parks, transportation, and infrastructure, a new fire station, and a 40,000 square foot senior center.
  • Taxes and levy: Sales taxes for the city would remain at 2%, and the City of Springdale can also levy a 1% local sales and use tax that will cover the cost of the bonds when they are paid off.

Find more on the story here.

posts.title: WSJ Highlights Northwest Arkansas's Booming Growth
posts.content:
The WSJ recently highlighted Northwest Arkansas's drastic transformation in the last few years. This growth can be partly attributed to initiatives by notable companies, foundations, and programs like the Northwest Arkansas Council’s Life Works Here.

  • Job opportunities: Companies like Walmart, Tyson Foods, J.B. Hunt Transport, and many others have been creating more and more job opportunities in the area.
  • The times they are a changin': Residents are drawn in by affordable housing, a small-town feel, outdoor activities, and city-like amenities. However, with its population projected to rise by over 300,000 over the next twenty years, the area's housing costs have seen a marked increase.

Read the full highlight here.

posts.title: Pinnacle Springs Project in Rogers Adds a New Restaurant Tenant
posts.content:
The Pinnacle Springs development in Rogers is getting its first restaurant tenant with North Carolina-based Firebirds Wood Fired Grill, an American cuisine concept serving up steak, seafood, and other signature dishes.

  • Flame up: Firebirds Wood Fired Grill, with approximately 60 U.S. locations, will open its first Arkansas location in the fourth quarter of 2024.
  • Developed: The development also includes a 350-unit apartment complex and two office buildings totaling about 29,000 square feet.

Read the full article here.

posts.title: CRISP & GREEN Announces Opening of First Arkansas Location in Bentonville
posts.content:
Healthy, fast-casual restaurant, CRISP & GREEN, is set to open its first Arkansas location in Bentonville this April. Founded in 2016, The restaurant serves up nutritious and delicious bowls, salads, smoothies, and more, made with sustainably and consciously sourced ingredients.

  • Committed to community: In addition to great food, the restaurant partners with local fitness experts to provide complimentary classes and looks forward to becoming an integral part of Bentonville's health-conscious and active community.
  • Rapid expansion: Encouraged by growing consumer demand for healthy and convenient food options, CRISP & GREEN is planning five locations across Arkansas and is on track to double its presence, with locations in 15 states in 2023.

Keep up with the new location here.

posts.title: Budget-Friendly Activities for Spring Break in Arkansas
posts.content:
If you aren't traveling anywhere for Spring Break this week, the Natural State offers families plenty of budget-friendly activities to enjoy close to home. Get your kids away from the screens and out into the great outdoors with these fun ideas.

  • Wild & Free: Spend a day birdwatching or exploring Arkansas' 1800+ miles of public hiking trails. You can also hop on a bike and explore local bike trails or paths.
  • Educational & Entertaining: Visit one of the many free or paid museums, visit a historic theater, or take to the stars on a camping adventure.

Check out the full guide from Only in Arkansas here.

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Has Something for Everyone This Spring Break
posts.content:
Crystal Bridges has something for everyone this Spring Break! Explore 120 acres of Ozark forest, with trails, galleries, art classes, and more.

  • Party on: Spring Break week kicked off with Pintura Fest this past Saturday, which included family-friendly activities, live painting, performances, and more.
  • There's more: With the opening party out of the way, there's still more fun to be had the rest of the week. You'll be able to explore Diego Rivera's vision of America, enjoy live performances, go through an obstacle course, learn from artist demos, and more!

Learn more about the museum here.

posts.title: Razorbacks Clinch Sweet 16 Bid with Victory Over 1 Seed Kansas
posts.content:
The Arkansas Razorbacks advanced to the program’s 14th Sweet 16 with a win over Kansas on Saturday, despite being down 12 points in the second half. Devo Davis was instrumental in the comeback, scoring 25 points, and Ricky Council IV sealed the victory with his last five points from the line.

  • No. 1 seed? No problem: This is the third year in a row Arkansas has faced a top-seeded team, bringing their record to 2-1 in these matchups in that timeframe. In the 2022 Sweet 16, the Razorbacks upset Gonzaga and cut Kansas' dance short in the second round of the 2021 tourney.
  • 6th man: Jordan Walsh came off the bench and went for 10 points and three rebounds. Kamani Johnson also had 10 boards and a putback late.

Relive the epic win here and watch Musselman show off his muscles here.

posts.title: Go Into the Jungle in NWA Through The Jungle Book Collaborative Performance
posts.content:
Experience the strength of the jungle in The Jungle Book, a collaboration between Trike Theatre, Ra-Ve Cultural Foundation, and Megha Rao of Dhirana Dance for an original adaptation of the beloved tale.

  • Perfect mixture: Mixing theatrical storytelling with classical Indian dance, The Jungle Book follows Mowgli's journey to trust her community instead of going alone.
  • Local talent: Featuring talented youth actors and dancers from across NWA, this engaging performance combines professional production, local talent, and an all-time favorite fable.

Mark your calendars for Mar 25 at 4pm, and get your tickets here.

posts.title: Beardedgoat Store And Headquarters Moving To Bentonville
posts.content:
Amazing outdoor gear for helping a friend move sounds way better than pizza. Help beardedgoat prepare for its big move to Bentonville by clearing out the inventory at its Fayetteville Square location during a massive sale lasting through the end of March.

  • Bittersweet goodbye: After four strong years in Fayetteville, beardedgoat is moving its headquarters and only storefront to Bentonville to join in on the city's surging outdoor adventure scene.
  • Very sweet deals: The sale is in-store only at the Downtown Fayetteville Square storefront, offering over 30 styles at significantly discounted prices, including a few archive styles unavailable online.

Follow beardedgoat HQ on Instagram for updates on the new location HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • Impressions Boutique has an opening for a Store Co-Manager*
  • NWA Cleaners is looking to hire an experienced House Cleaner. Email here if you or someone you know is interested.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it HERE!

posts.title: State of the City Address Paints Bright Picture for Springdale in 2023
posts.content:
Springdale is flourishing in 2023, boasting $30 million in uncommitted reserves and $9 million in ARPA funds, allowing the city to provide essential services while maintaining rapid growth.

  • No tax increase: The city is moving forward with the upcoming bond initiative vote on May 9 to fund four project categories, and approval of the bond will use existing resources without any tax increase.
  • Responsible growth: The bond initiative includes investing in parks and recreational facilities, building a new Fire Station 10, and funding transportation infrastructure, enhancing the experience of Springdale's citizens.

Read or watch Springdale's State of the City Address HERE.

posts.title: XNA on Track for Pre-Pandemic Enplanement Levels in 2023
posts.content:
Though affected by the pandemic, XNA is on track to be fully recovered this year, and projections show it's even on track to surpass Clinton National Airport’s enplanement levels in eight years.

  • Growth plan: Right-of-way acquisition for XNA’s 3.4-mile access road from Highway 612 to Highway 264 is nearly complete, and work on extending Highway 612 from Highway 112 to Highway 412 is expected to be announced by the end of 2023.
  • Recovering rates: Passenger volume through XNA's TSA checkpoint is up 20% in March over March of 2019, and February enplanements were up 30% over 2022 levels.

Read more about XNA's growth HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Our goal for today and this weekend is to either make it through today without getting pinched or have you wearing the color green all weekend. Here's whats happening around NWA this weekend for St. Patrick's Day:

  • Spring fling: The annual St. Patty's Day Parade will make its way down Spring and Main Streets at 2p tomorrow in downtown Eureka Springs.
  • Drink up: Saturday is World Water Day with Lifewater International, a local nonprofit raising awareness and changing lives though water access. They will be at Coler from Noon-3p tomorrow.
  • Swing away: Down south in Fayetteville, Arkansas will host its SEC baseball season opener against Auburn Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.
  • Green machine: While you're down in Fay, the annual St. Patrick's Day Pub Crawl, Dickson Street's longest-running pub crawl, begins at 5p on tonight at Ryleigh's.
  • All aboard: Catch a ride this weekend on the Arkansas-Missouri - a great family activity to have a unique view of the Boston Mountains.
  • Chasing waterfalls: Speaking of the outdoors, you might be able to catch a few waterfalls this weekend in the natural state.
  • Tis the season: The Fayetteville outdoor farmers market begins Saturday at the Fayetteville Square with a special Spring Fling edition this week and next.

Have a wonderful green weekend and we will talk to you Monday!

posts.title: Fayetteville Farmers' Market Set to Return this Weekend
posts.content:
Fayetteville Farmers' Market is here to herald in spring this season!

  • Mark your calendars: This year's market will begin with two "Spring Fling" markets on March 18 and 25, followed by regular Saturday markets starting Apr 1, with an online ordering option for even more convenience.
  • Something for everyone: With around 70 vendors, there are plenty of options for any taste. You can check out some of the different options here on the online order site.

Find out more on the Fayetteville Farmers' Market website.

posts.title: Explore the Natural Beauty of NWA's Waterfalls
posts.content:
Rainy springs offer the perfect backdrop for exploring Northwest Arkansas's many waterfalls. From cascading falls to natural bridges, beginners and seasoned hikers alike will enjoy these hikes highlighted by 37 North Expeditions.

  • Glory Hole Falls: Moderately challenging hike to a 30-foot waterfall and natural bridge.
  • Hemmed-In Hollow Falls: Strenuous, dangerous hike to the tallest waterfall between the Rockies and the Appalachians - 209-ft!

See all the falls in the full guide of top NWA waterfalls here to start planning your next hike.

posts.title: Discover the 2023-2024 Procter & Gamble Broadway Series at Walton Arts Center
posts.content:
Break a leg! The Walton Arts Center announced its 2023-2024 Procter & Gamble Broadway Series on Mar 13, featuring six shows – five Arkansas premieres – and three add-ons, offering something for theater lovers of all kinds.

  • Ready for the show: Subscriptions for the season are available now, with discounts, free ticket exchange and replacement, and prime seating.
  • Full lineup: In addition to the musicals from Sondheim, Aaron Sorkin, and the classic "Aladdin" the Broadway Series will include "Les Miserables", "Hairspray", and "Company" among others.

Get all the details on the series HERE.

posts.title: Feed More Than Your Need For Speed During The 3rd Annual Loaf & Sole 5K
posts.content:
Lace up your running shoes for the 3rd annual Loaf & Sole 5k in Fayetteville on Apr 29 at 7:30a, benefitting Table 7three, a non-profit food ministry dedicated to feeding the community.

  • Full course: The race will begin and end at Genesis Church, following the same path Tabitha, Table 7three's airstream, uses to serve food at Walker Park in Fayetteville.
  • Swag: Runners and walkers alike will receive a free bagel coupon for Ozark Mountain Bagel, a finisher medal, and a t-shirt designed by one of Table 7three's diners.

Sign up for the Loaf & Sole 5k HERE.

posts.title: Nosh Brings New Orleans-Inspired Eats To Bentonville
posts.content:
Hayne Begley, a well-known food entrepreneur in Arkansas, has expanded his portfolio of eateries with the opening of Nosh NOLA, a New Orleans-inspired restaurant inside Bentonville Brewing Co.

  • The classics: The restaurant offers menu items like the "Nosh" burger and Tot’chos, as well as classic New Orleans staples like poboys, muffulettas, and red beans & rice.
  • Not his first rodeo: Hayne Begley is also the owner of the popular Delta Biscuit Co., which he opened in 2018 in Little Rock and then moved to Bentonville in 2022.

Read more about the new restaurant HERE.

posts.title: NWA Housing Sales Dip As Available Inventory Grows
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas's home sales decreased by 20.8%, while the available home inventory rose by over 100% in the second half of 2022, according to the latest Arvest Bank Skyline Report.

  • Findings: The slowdown in home sales has resulted in a 177% year-over-year increase in the number of homes listed on Multi Listing Services, and the average home prices in Benton County have dropped by .5%, the first decrease for the county in years.
  • Recalibrating: The team at Arvest remains optimistic that these metrics suggest the Northwest Arkansas housing market is potentially recalibrating to a more sustainable pace.

Read more on the local housing market HERE.

posts.title: New Flavors At Carmelitas Modern Mexican Cuisine
posts.content:
Carmelitas is still rolling out its soft opening, but the staff is already whipping up some incredible modern Mexican cuisine to serve in their laid-back environment and outside on their dog-friendly patio.

  • Cali-flavors: Founded by Jeremy and Karla Putts, Carmelitas got its start catering weddings during the pandemic and quickly gained attention for its distinctive flavors inspired by San Diego roots; their antojeria menu combines traditional Mexican and Californian street food classics.
  • Initial recs: We'll definitely be returning for more menu items, but our first trip has us pretty high on the Gorditas and Torta de Asada. Ask about the off-menu grilled street corn as an appetizer!

Follow Carmelitas on Instagram for updates HERE.

posts.title: Walton Art Center's Artosphere Festival Returns This May
posts.content:
Artosphere Festival returns this May, providing nearly a month's worth of immersive art, music, and nature experiences throughout Northwest Arkansas.

  • Art all over: Organized by Walton Arts Center, the multi-week festival includes free and low-cost events ranging from performances by full orchestras and local bands in parks, outdoor venues, and bars to Indie film screenings and activities like yoga or biking paired with live music.
  • In fashion: Fashion Machine, a new addition to this year's festival, will give 28 local children the opportunity to show off their creativity and textile design skills, reworking articles of clothing from the audience with the help of professional artists and textile experts from Canada's Theatre SKAM.

Explore the full schedule for Artosphere Festival HERE.

posts.title: Answer The Call To Nursing At Harding University
posts.content:
If you've felt the call to serve others and want to turn that passion into a fulfilling nursing career, Harding University's hybrid accelerated Bachelor of Science in nursing track might be the perfect fit.

  • Faithful care: Harding University's unique curriculum utilizes on-site skills labs and clinical rotations in Northwest Arkansas to prepare future nurses to serve with a Christ-inspired, servant-leadership mindset. 
  • Jumpstart: Applicants can apply with a previous bachelor's degree in any field or at least 64 college credits and complete the degree in as few as 16 months. Enroll for 2023 and receive a $10,000 scholarship upon admission. 

Contact admissions to learn more HERE.

posts.title: The Hogeye Marathon Is Just A Month Away
posts.content:
The 47th Annual Hogey Marathon is next month, with the marathon, half marathon, & 4-person relay scheduled for Apr 15, followed by the Sunday Fun Day 5k & 10k on Apr 16.

  • Hogeye history: Founded in 1977, the Hogeye Marathon has attracted runners to Springdale for over four decades, providing an exciting spring race opportunity and raising support for local nonprofits.
  • Good running: Proceeds raised by The Hogeye Marathon & Relays benefit local charities like the American Wheelchair Mission, Jackson Graves Foundation, Kendrick Fincher Hydration for Life, and Meals on Wheels of Washington County.

Register for the race or to volunteer HERE.
